title: In France, 1,040 anti-Semitic acts perpetrated since October 7
description: France's Jewish population, estimated at over 500,000, is the largest in Europe and the third-biggest in the world, after Israel and the United States.

title: Full steam ahead for China's Belt and Road Initiative in Indonesia
description: Under the impetus of its president, Joko Widodo, Indonesia has embraced the Belt and Road Initiative project, attracting a record amount of Chinese investment. Meanwhile, Beijing is counting on the vast archipelago to expand its influence in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: 'To finance the energy transition, companies will have to reduce their shareholder remuneration'
description: France's environmental goals can only be financed by transferring income from the wealthiest individuals to the government, to domestic savings, and to companies who invest in the environmental transition.

title: Ivan Segré: 'Israel's future lies in an alliance with progressive Arab forces'
description: In an interview with Le Monde, the philosopher Ivan Segré considers Israel's military response to be a 'political and strategic error.' The French-Israeli philosopher specializing in Talmudic studies argues for a Zionism backed by democratic movements in the Middle East.

title: Ethiopia's Tola, Kenya's Obiri the winners at New York City Marathon
description: Tamirat Tola won the men's race in a time of 2:4:58, a course record. Reigning Boston Marathon champion Hellen Obiri won the women's race in 2:27:23.

title: Storm Domingos: French regions worried after third storm in a week
description: The new storm that swept through France on November 4 and 5 has not caused any major damage, according to initial reports, but has complicated recovery efforts in areas already hit by Storm Ciaran.

title: Djokovic beats Dimitrov for seventh Paris Masters title
description: Novak Djokovic won 6-4, 6-3 to clinch his 40th Masters 1000 title, and stretching his winning run to 18 matches.

title: 'The colonial issue is the last taboo of France's 19th and 20th century history'
description: Nicolas Bancel and Pascal Blanchard, two historians, advocate for creating a 'museum of colonization,' like in other European countries, which would put antagonistic memories into perspective and help millions of people see themselves reflected in history.

title: Elysée Palace brings back public changing of guard
description: The home of the French presidency said the ceremony, which was abandoned 27 years ago, would take place once a month starting on Tuesday.

title: Paris FC's gamble: Free tickets for all until the end of the season
description: The club, whose men's team competes in Ligue 2 and women's team in Division 1, has announced that 15,000 of the 17,000 seats at Stade Charléty will be available free of charge for all league matches until the end of the season.

title: Israel minister reprimanded over Gaza nuclear 'option' comment
description: Heritage Minister Amichai Eliyahu, an ultranationalist member of Netanyahu's coalition, was suspended from government meetings. The prime minister's office said Eliyahu was 'disconnected from reality.'

title: France urges 'immediate humanitarian truce' in Gaza war
description: Foreign Minister Catherine Colonna called for 'an immediate, durable and observed humanitarian truce', adding that she was supporting a UN resolution to that effect.

title: More and more Israelis are signing up to own a gun
description: Since Hamas's attack on October 7, 180,000 applications for permits to carry weapons have been submitted in Israel. The authorities are trying to keep pace with the growing demand for security.

title: Philippines: Radio broadcaster fatally shot while live on Facebook
description: Juan Jumalon, 57, the 4th journalist killed in the Philippines since June 2022, was shot and killed in his 'own home, which also served as the radio station.'

title: New York City Marathon: The dark side of the race
description: This weekend, 50,000 people will take to the starting line of the New York City Marathon on Staten Island. A crowd that poses major environmental challenges – pee breaks among them.

title: Come for the culture, maybe don't stay for the food: Are museum restaurants worth a visit?
description: With high prices and homogenized flavors in menus designed to please everyone, many restaurants run by renowned chefs fail to offer gastronomic delights that match the establishment's reputation. However, there are noteworthy exceptions.

title: Pakistan deports thousands of refugees: 'I was born here, I don't know anyone in Afghanistan. Only God can help me'
description: The government has decided to send 1.7 million undocumented Afghans back to their country, despite the risks associated with the Taliban regime. Forty-nine detention centers have opened throughout the country.

title: As war rages in Gaza, North Africa's streets are united, if not its governments
description: Despite rivalries and political divisions between the region's countries, North Africa is reuniting around widespread movements in solidarity with the Palestinians.

title: Moshe Dayan, Yitzhak Rabin and the future of Israel
description: The two Israeli politicians long ago laid down the terms of Israel's dilemma about Gaza.

title: The slaughter of wild horses in Australia has become a battle 'for the soul' of the country
description: Imported by early settlers, 'brumbies' are national symbols for some; for others, they're just another invasive species that needs to be strictly controlled to protect native species.

title: Hamburg airport traffic halted over police operation
description: According to the newspaper Bild, 27 flights – 6 departures and 21 arrivals – and about 3,200 passengers are impacted by the situation, believed to be a 'hostage situation' over a custody dispute.

title: Dunkirk and Gaza: A relationship tested by war
description: Since their twinning in 1996, the northern French city of Dunkirk and the Palestinian enclave created multiple projects, until Hamas came to power in 2006. There were plans to relaunch this partnership, but the attack on Israel dampened this hope.

title: Protests from US to Europe call for halt to Israeli bombing of Gaza
description: On Saturday, Joe Biden said that progress was made in the US efforts to persuade Israel to agree to a 'humanitarian pause.'
